info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 08 at 5:09PM EST until January 11 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in North and South Carolina... Broad River near Blacksburg affecting Cleveland County in North Carolina and Cherokee County in South Carolina. .A potent storm system is expected to produce 3.5-4.5 inches of rainfall across the upper Broad River watershed from Tuesday morning through Tuesday evening. This rainfall will quickly overwhelm saturated soils and result in excessive runoff and significant stream rises across Cleveland and Cherokee counties, with some small tributaries of the Broad River possibly exceeding bankfull and causing nuisance to Minor flooding of adjacent areas as early as late Tuesday morning. This excessive flow will cause the Broad River from near Gaston Shoals to Cherokee Falls to exceed Action/Advisory Stage Tuesday afternoon and approach Minor Flood Stage late Tuesday night into early Wednesday morning. This will result in common, nuisance flooding of low-lying areas adjacent to the Broad River. Residents are advised to move vulnerable property to higher ground and stay up-to-date by monitoring the latest river levels and forecasts. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON TO EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Nuisance flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. Minor flooding is possible. * WHERE...Broad River near Blacksburg. * WHEN...From Tuesday afternoon to early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Minor Flood Stage. The Broad River may be flooding River Rd and Little Hope Rd near US 29. Farmland flooding is continuing adjacent to the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:30 PM EST Monday the stage was 4.2 feet and falling slowly. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 15.8 feet early Wednesday morning. The river may continue to rise to near or just above Minor Flood Stage Wednesday morning. If the river significantly exceeds Minor Flood Stage, a River Flood Warning may be issued. Please closely monitor the latest levels and forecasts. - Action/Advisory Stage is 13.0 feet. - Minor Flood Stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. For detailed information including observed and forecast stages, flood impacts, flood history, FEMA Flood Hazard Layers, and more, please visit: https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=gsp The next statement will be issued before late Wednesday night at 100 AM EST.
